column4: so after waiting patiently for over 1/2 hr, still no help, where is the communit at
:) whats your question?
i have one of those seemingly infamous 'GNOME Power Manager has not been installed correctly' problems in ubuntu 10.10 netbook edition
well unfortunately, off hand I dont know the answer.  I will look around real quick for some options
i tried numerous provided solutions out there but since i'm a newb on linux, i'm not familiar with sudo commands besides what's explicitly given that i can just copy
but any help/suggestions you can that i can try out, all the more welcome :)
I understand .... just hang out a few and I will look around. Someone else may be able to help also, just ask your question again if unanswered for some time
is that the only message u get? any other abnormal behavior
i suspect that i might have run out of HD space but after using the 'df' command, i'm only using 70156812 of the available 73900256 1K blocks
and that's the only abnormal behavior experienced so far
and i don't know how to get access to internet connection from the terminal either
what kind of iNet access are you trying to get from terminal thats not available in the desktop?
should be available as well
i'm trying to hop onto the campus wifi
your issue looks like it may be caused due to low space in the root drive
and also thanks a lot for coming to my aid also, appreciate it!
and if you know of any good linux books for beginners to learn from, please share
the web has a lot of great resources  :)
well what the few place(s) you would go to then? :)
and the old faithful method is to get a machine and just start working it a little at a time ... whats the worst thatcan happen .... start over???  :P
well i'll definitely start tinkering around more once i get a handle on the command lines haha, but after i offload all my files onto external storage :D
